claims.text: We are updating Grok's capabilities with a new autoregressive image generation model, code-named Aurora, available on the 𝕏 platform. We've enhanced Grok's image generation abilities with a new model, code-named Aurora. Aurora is an autoregressive mixture-of-experts network trained to predict the next token from interleaved text and image data. We trained the model on billions of examples from the internet, giving it a deep understanding of the world. As a result, it excels at photorealistic ren...

claims.text:
Grok 4 has emerged as a transformative tool in the landscape of AI-generated visuals, providing users with a new way to create high-quality images. With its advancements over Grok 3, Grok 4 is designed to blend innovative technology with user-friendly experiences.

omissions: Okay, I've reviewed the provided information about Grok's recent image generation capabilities. Here are some key omissions and gaps in the evidence, focusing on areas where more credible, authoritative sources are needed:

**Technical Specifications and Performance Benchmarks:** There's a lack of detailed information from xAI or independent researchers regarding the architecture, training data, and performance metrics of the "Aurora" model. We need specifics on image resolution, generation speed, and comparisons against other leading image generation models (e.g., DALL-E 3, Midjourney) from peer-reviewed studies or reputable tech publications. This would provide a more objective assessment of Grok's capabilities beyond marketing claims.

**Safety and Ethical Considerations (Beyond NSFW):** While the evidence mentions the "spicy mode" (NSFW content), there's a gap in information regarding broader safety and ethical considerations. Specifically, we need information from xAI or independent audits about measures taken to prevent the generation of harmful content such as deepfakes, biased imagery, or content that violates copyright or intellectual property laws. Reports from AI safety organizations or academic research on these aspects would be valuable.

commentary.text:
The recent release of Grok Imagine by xAI marks a notable development in the field of AI-driven image generation [S1, S6]. This tool allows users to create images and videos from text prompts [S4]. The underlying technology utilizes an autoregressive mixture-of-experts network, trained on billions of internet examples, to predict the next token from interleaved text and image data [S1, S2]. This architecture enables the system to understand and interpret complex visual concepts, offering precise control over image generation [S5].

One distinctive feature of Grok Imagine is its "spicy mode," which allows for the generation of NSFW content [S2, S4]. While the image generation functionalities are still being developed [S3], xAI aims to position Grok as a boundary-pushing AI tool [S4]. It's important to note that the accuracy of the generated images may vary [S4], but improvements are expected over time [S4].

In conclusion, Grok Imagine represents a new AI image and video generator [S1, S6] that uses sophisticated neural networks [S5] and is expected to improve over time [S4].
